note.p: Career: Partner in the business of Christy & Co, Gracechurch Street, London; Director, London Joint-Stock Bank; travelled as his interest in ethnology developed, in Denmark, Sweden and Norway (1852 and 1853), and in United States and Canada (1856); France (after 1858); caught a sever cold on a trip to Belgium, then developed inflammation of the lungs, of which he died (1865); philanthropists, especially in relation to the Irish famine (1847); left his collections to the nation, with money to ensure their exhibition; housed in the British Museum (after 1884)
Memberships: FSA; FLS; FGS (1858); Geological Institute, Vienna (Corresponding);
Soc N Ant Copenhagen (Foundation Member); Academy of Sciences of Stockholm (Corresponding)
Notes: Note on election certificate: 'Selected - April 1865. Died before the Election June 1/65'
